definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: The anti-aircraft guns riddled the plane's wings with bullets.
sentences.chinese: 防空炮把机翼打得弹痕累累。

sentences.english: Outside the museum, two bullet- riddled cars round out the story.
sentences.chinese: 在博物馆外面，两辆弹痕累累的汽车讲述着这个故事。

sentences.english: The concrete surface of the road was riddled with bullets.
sentences.chinese: 马路上的水泥地面，弹痕累累。

sentences.english: There were many more bullet-scarred and derelict houses.
sentences.chinese: 被废弃的弹痕累累的房屋更多了。

definition: to blow up/to destroy with explosives
the tiles are broken, the walls dilapidated
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
lit. bumps and bruises everywhere (idiom); fig. an ugly shambles/devastation everywhere
